text: TLB Entry: | Page Number Memory is word addressable. « Word size = 4 Bytes « Page size = 8 KB = 2!! words « Virtual Memory size = 24 words « Number of pages possible = 2%% ' « Number of bits required for Page number = 53 bits « Number of bits required for Page offset = 64 — 53 = 11 bits At a time TLB contains 128 = 27 distinct page numbers. If a page number is found in TLB then there will be a hit for all the words (Word addresses) of that Page. 1 - page hit implies 21 distinct virtual address hits. So 27page hitimplies 27 % 211 = 28 % 210 — 256 % 210 virtual address hits Option B. At most, 256 * 21° distinct virtual addresses can be translated without any TLB miss.
